definitions: showing an aggressive lack of respect or acting too confidently
having an excessively bright or garish appearance that draws attention
examples: His brash comments offended everyone at the meeting
The young entrepreneur's brash attitude alienated potential investors
She wore a brash neon yellow jacket to the party
The restaurant's brash decor clashed with its elegant menu

definitions: having the yellowish color or metallic quality characteristic of brass
tastelessly showy or loud in manner, appearance, or sound
examples: The antique lamp had a brassy finish that needed polishing
Her hair took on a brassy tone after bleaching
The singer's brassy voice filled the entire auditorium
His brassy personality made him hard to ignore at parties

definitions: showing no shame or embarrassment about behavior others find shocking
made of brass or having the appearance of brass metal
examples: Her brazen lie shocked everyone who knew the truth
The thief made a brazen attempt to steal in broad daylight
The brazen bells rang out across the village square
Ancient warriors carried brazen shields into battle

definitions: having separated or withdrawn from a larger group or organization
designed to break apart easily when force is applied for safety
examples: The breakaway faction formed their own political party
Several breakaway provinces declared independence from the nation
The costume featured breakaway sleeves for the quick change
Modern cars have breakaway mirrors that snap off in accidents

definitions: moving or happening at a dangerously fast pace that risks harm
examples: The taxi drove at breakneck speed through the narrow streets
They worked at a breakneck pace to meet the deadline

definitions: having a chest or breast of a specified type or appearance
examples: The double-breasted jacket looked formal and elegant
A red-breasted robin landed on the garden fence

definitions: uttered in a quiet voice with audible breathing or exhalation
examples: She breathed words of comfort to the frightened child
His breathed whisper could barely be heard over the wind

definitions: having difficulty breathing due to exertion, emotion, or medical condition
so exciting or beautiful that it takes one's breath away
examples: She was breathless after running up five flights of stairs
The breathless patient struggled to speak to the doctor
The breathless beauty of the mountain vista stunned the hikers
Critics gave breathless reviews of the stunning performance

definitions: so remarkable or beautiful that it takes one's breath away in amazement
examples: The view from the cliff was absolutely breathtaking
Her breathtaking performance earned a standing ovation

definitions: showing evidence of good manners and refined social background
kept specifically for the purpose of producing offspring
examples: His breeding showed in his polite and refined manner
People of breeding knew which fork to use at dinner
The farm kept several breeding mares for their horse program
These breeding rabbits produce prize-winning offspring

definitions: characterized by light winds or gentle air movement
showing a casual, carefree, and cheerfully confident manner
examples: It was a breezy spring day perfect for flying kites
The breezy hilltop offered relief from the valley heat
Her breezy attitude made everyone feel relaxed and welcome
He gave a breezy wave as he strolled past

definitions: relating to a bride or a wedding ceremony and its traditions
examples: She wore her mother's bridal gown for the ceremony
The bridal party posed for photos in the garden

definitions: filled to the very top edge of a container
showing or containing a large amount of a particular emotion
examples: The cup was brimming with hot coffee
The brimming bucket threatened to spill with each step
Her eyes were brimming with tears of joy
He was brimming with excitement about the promotion

definitions: having a brownish or tawny color with darker streaks or spots
examples: The brindle Great Dane had beautiful tiger-like stripes
She adopted a brindle pit bull from the shelter

definitions: showing quick, energetic movement or manner of doing things
pleasantly cool and fresh, especially describing weather or air
examples: She maintained a brisk walking pace during her morning exercise
The manager conducted a brisk meeting that lasted only minutes
The brisk autumn air made everyone want to wear sweaters
A brisk breeze swept fallen leaves across the sidewalk

definitions: covered with short, stiff hairs or similar rigid projections
showing signs of anger, defensiveness, or being easily offended
examples: His bristly beard scratched her cheek when they hugged
The bristly cactus protected itself with sharp spines
She became bristly whenever someone criticized her work
His bristly response showed he was still angry

definitions: hard but liable to break or shatter easily under stress
appearing sharp or harsh without warmth or flexibility in manner
examples: The brittle cookies crumbled at the slightest touch
Cold weather made the plastic brittle and prone to cracking
Her brittle laugh revealed her discomfort with the situation
His brittle smile didn't reach his eyes

definitions: brought up or introduced a topic for discussion or consideration
examples: She finally broached the subject of their relationship problems
The sensitive topic was carefully broached at the meeting

definitions: transmitting or using a wide range of frequencies for telecommunications
examples: Their broadband internet connection allowed fast streaming speeds
The broadband spectrum carries multiple signals simultaneously

definitions: having broad flat leaves rather than needles, describing certain trees
examples: The broadleaf forest changed colors beautifully in autumn
Oak trees are broadleaf species that lose leaves in winter

definitions: positioned or moving with the side facing a particular direction
attacking or criticizing forcefully on all or many points
examples: The ship was hit broadside by a massive wave
He parked broadside to the curb instead of parallel
The article was a broadside attack on government policies
She launched a broadside criticism of the proposal

definitions: completely without money or financial resources
examples: He was broke after paying all his college tuition
The company went broke during the economic recession

definitions: relating to the bronchi or airways that carry air to lungs
examples: She suffered from bronchial infections every winter season
The doctor prescribed bronchial medication for his cough

definitions: having a brownish color like the metal alloy bronze
made from or coated with the metal alloy of copper and tin
examples: Her skin had a bronze glow from the summer sun
The bronze paint gave the car a vintage appearance
The bronze statue stood in the center of the plaza
Athletes competed for bronze medals at the Olympics

definitions: having the appearance or color resembling bronze metal
examples: The bronzy shimmer of her eyeshadow caught the light
Autumn leaves turned a beautiful bronzy shade

definitions: appearing darkly thoughtful, mysterious, or threateningly moody
showing deep thought about something that causes worry or unhappiness
examples: The actor perfected his brooding look for the vampire role
Dark brooding clouds gathered on the horizon
She spent hours in brooding silence after the argument
His brooding expression revealed his inner turmoil

definitions: showing the affection, loyalty, or behavior characteristic of a brother
examples: He gave her brotherly advice about her career choices
Their brotherly bond remained strong despite living far apart

definitions: having a color that is somewhat brown or tending toward brown
examples: The old photograph had faded to a brownish tint
She noticed brownish spots appearing on the banana peel

definitions: causing or likely to cause bruises to the body
severely damaging to one's feelings, confidence, or reputation
examples: The bruising tackle left marks on his legs
She avoided bruising contact sports after her injury
It was a bruising political campaign full of personal attacks
The bruising criticism affected her self-confidence

definitions: describing a man or boy with dark brown or black hair
examples: The brunet actor was cast as the romantic lead
Her brunet brother contrasted with her blonde hair

definitions: describing a woman or girl with dark brown or black hair
examples: The brunette actress wore a stunning red dress
She decided to remain brunette instead of dyeing her hair

definitions: cleaned, smoothed, or groomed by stroking with a brush
having a soft raised texture created by brushing the surface
examples: Her carefully brushed hair shone in the morning light
The brushed teeth felt clean and smooth
He preferred brushed cotton sheets for their softness
The brushed metal finish hid fingerprints well

definitions: covered with or consisting of small trees, shrubs, and undergrowth
examples: The brushy hillside made hiking difficult and slow
Rabbits hid in the brushy areas near the trail

definitions: abrupt or offhand in speech or manner, often seeming rude
examples: His brusque response hurt her feelings unnecessarily
The doctor's brusque manner intimidated nervous patients

definitions: describing sparkling wine or champagne that is very dry
examples: They toasted with brut champagne at the wedding reception
She preferred brut wines to sweeter varieties

definitions: involving only physical strength without thought or planning
characterized by lack of reasoning or intelligence; purely instinctive
examples: They used brute force to break down the door
The problem required brute strength rather than finesse
His brute ignorance of social norms embarrassed everyone
The animal acted on brute instinct to protect its young

definitions: resembling a brute in being cruel, coarse, or lacking intelligence
examples: His brutish behavior at dinner shocked the other guests
The brutish guard showed no mercy to prisoners

definitions: producing a steady stream of bubbles in liquid
showing irrepressible enthusiasm, excitement, or high spirits
examples: The bubbling pot of soup simmered on the stove
We heard the bubbling brook before we saw it
She was bubbling with enthusiasm about her new project
His bubbling personality made him popular at parties

definitions: containing bubbles or fizz, especially in drinks
having a cheerful, lively, and enthusiastic personality
examples: The bubbly champagne tickled her nose as she drank
Children love bubbly bath water filled with soap
Her bubbly personality brightened everyone's day at work
The bubbly hostess made all guests feel welcome

definitions: relating to bubonic plague, a disease causing swollen lymph nodes
examples: The bubonic plague devastated Europe in the Middle Ages
Scientists study bubonic bacteria to prevent future outbreaks

definitions: relating to the pleasant aspects of countryside and country life
examples: They enjoyed a bucolic picnic in the meadow
The bucolic scenery inspired many landscape painters

definitions: beginning to develop or show signs of future potential
examples: She was a budding artist showing great promise
Their budding romance blossomed into lasting love

definitions: relating to or concerning a budget or financial planning
examples: The company faced serious budgetary constraints this quarter
Budgetary decisions affected all department spending plans

definitions: having a pale yellowish-brown color like soft leather
having a well-developed muscular physique from exercise
being very knowledgeable and enthusiastic about a particular subject
examples: She wore a buff colored jacket with dark pants
The buff envelope contained important documents
He stayed buff by working out five days a week
The buff athletes competed in the bodybuilding contest
She's a real film buff who watches movies every night
History buffs gathered for the Civil War reenactment

definitions: equipped with hidden electronic listening devices for surveillance
feeling annoyed, bothered, or upset about something
examples: The spy discovered his hotel room was bugged
They suspected their phones were bugged by authorities
She was really bugged by his constant interruptions
Something about the situation bugged him all day

definitions: infested with insects or containing many bugs
having defects or glitches, especially in software or systems
examples: The buggy summer evening made outdoor dining unpleasant
They avoided the buggy swamp area during camping
The buggy software crashed repeatedly during testing
Users complained about the buggy new app update

definitions: having a strong, muscular physique from exercise and training
examples: The built athlete easily lifted the heavy weights
She was attracted to his built physique and confidence

definitions: round and swollen in shape, resembling a bulb
examples: His bulbous nose was red from the cold weather
The plant had strange bulbous roots underground

definitions: swelling or protruding outward in a rounded shape
examples: His bulging muscles strained against his tight shirt
The bulging suitcase wouldn't close properly

definitions: taking up much space, especially in an awkward or inconvenient way
examples: The bulky winter coat was hard to pack in the suitcase
They struggled to move the bulky furniture upstairs
